meanings.def: a small oval object with a thin hard shell produced by a female bird and containing a young bird; a similar object (without a hard shell) produced by a female fish, insect, etc.
examples: The female sits on the eggs until they hatch.
The fish lay thousands of eggs at one time.
crocodile eggs
Many reptiles bury their eggs.
She lays a clutch of four eggs on average.
The males stay and guard the eggs.

meanings.def: a bird’s egg, especially one from a chicken, that is eaten as food
examples: a boiled egg
bacon and eggs
fried/poached/scrambled eggs
Bind the mixture together with a little beaten egg.
You've got some egg on your shirt.
egg yolks/whites
egg noodles
hen's/duck/quail eggs
a chocolate egg (= made from chocolate in the shape of an egg)
Crack two eggs into the mixture.
Separate the eggs, putting the whites to one side.
We're just decorating eggs for the egg hunt.

meanings.def: a cell that combines with a sperm to create a baby or young animal
examples: The male sperm fertilizes the female egg.
an egg donor
Many women conceive through the use of a donor egg.

meanings.def: a situation in which it is difficult to tell which one of two things was the cause of the other
something that has some good parts and some bad ones
examples: Their investment plan shows the familiar curate's egg pattern of some bits doing well and others doing badly.

meanings.def: a person who you know will behave well/badly
to be made to look stupid
examples: They were left with egg on their faces when only ten people showed up.

meanings.def: to destroy something that would make you rich, successful, etc.
to rely on one particular course of action for success rather than giving yourself several different possibilities
examples: I’ve applied for several jobs. I don’t want to put all my eggs in one basket.

meanings.def: used to say that something is definitely true
to tell or show somebody how to do something that they can already do well, and probably better than you can
you cannot achieve something important without causing a few small problems

idioms.def: a situation in which it is difficult to tell which one of two things was the cause of the other
something that has some good parts and some bad ones
examples: Their investment plan shows the familiar curate's egg pattern of some bits doing well and others doing badly.

idioms.def: a person who you know will behave well/badly

idioms.idiom: have/be left with egg on/all over your face
idioms.def: to be made to look stupid
examples: They were left with egg on their faces when only ten people showed up.

idioms.idiom: kill the goose that lays the golden egg/eggs
idioms.def: to destroy something that would make you rich, successful, etc.

idioms.idiom: put all your eggs in one basket
idioms.def: to rely on one particular course of action for success rather than giving yourself several different possibilities
examples: I’ve applied for several jobs. I don’t want to put all my eggs in one basket.

idioms.def: used to say that something is definitely true

idioms.idiom: teach your grandmother to suck eggs
idioms.def: to tell or show somebody how to do something that they can already do well, and probably better than you can

idioms.idiom: you can’t make an omelette without breaking eggs
idioms.def: you cannot achieve something important without causing a few small problems
